content.text: How TO - Become a Front-End Developer
A Front-End Developer is someone who creates websites and web applications.
content.html: A Front-End Developer is someone who creates websites and web applications.

content.text: The Front-End Developer creates things that the user sees.
content.html: The Front-End Developer creates things that the user sees.

content.text: It is a popular job, and everyone can become a Front-End Developer.
content.html: It is a popular job, and everyone can become a Front-End Developer.

content.text: Why become a Front-End Developer
It is fun and creative.
content.html: It is fun and creative.

content.text: It is flexible - you can work from anywhere!
content.html: It is flexible - you can work from anywhere!

content.text: Many companies are looking for Front-End Developers.
content.html: Many companies are looking for Front-End Developers.

content.text: What does a Front-End Developer do
The main responsibility of a Front-End Developer is the User interface .
content.html: The main responsibility of a Front-End Developer is the User interface.

content.text: Simply put, create things that the user sees.
content.html: Simply put, create things that the user sees.

content.text: Note: If you don't know what a Front-End Developer is, you can learn more about it in the What is a Front-End Developer tutorial.
content.html: Note: If you don't know what a Front-End Developer is, you can learn more about it in the What is a Front-End Developer tutorial.

content.text: The difference between Front-End and Back-End is that Front-End refers to how a web page looks, while back-end refers to how it works.
content.html: The difference between Front-End and Back-End is that Front-End refers to how a web page looks, while back-end refers to how it works.

content.text: You also think of Front-End as client-side and Back-End as server-side .
content.html: You also think of Front-End as client-side and Back-End as server-side.

content.text: Where do I start
HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are the basic languages you need to know to create a website.
content.html: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript are the basic languages you need to know to create a website.

content.text: To become a Front-End Developer, start with the subjects below, in the following order:
content.html: To become a Front-End Developer, start with the subjects below, in the following order:

content.text: You have to code to learn how to code. Practice a lot!
content.html: You have to code to learn how to code. Practice a lot!

content.text: Have you ever heard about W3Schools Spaces ? Here you can create a free website using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
content.html: Have you ever heard about W3Schools Spaces? Here you can create a free website using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

content.text: * no credit card required
content.html: * no credit card required

content.text: Learn and practice JavaScript and CSS frameworks and libraries such as:
content.html: Learn and practice JavaScript and CSS frameworks and libraries such as:

content.text: Bootstrap - Learn Bootstrap
content.html: Bootstrap - Learn Bootstrap

content.text: SASS - Learn SASS
content.html: SASS - Learn SASS

content.text: jQuery - Learn jQuery
content.html: jQuery - Learn jQuery

content.text: React - Learn React
content.html: React - Learn React

content.text: Version control with Git - Learn Git
content.html: Version control with Git - Learn Git

content.text: Knowing the frameworks and libraries will make you more attractive in the job market.
content.html: Knowing the frameworks and libraries will make you more attractive in the job market.

content.text: Learning RESTful APIs is a bonus. This will allow you to connect the Front-End to the Back-End and its logic.
content.html: Learning RESTful APIs is a bonus. This will allow you to connect the Front-End to the Back-End and its logic.

content.text: Relevant skills
A Front-End Developer can have a big tool-box of skills.
content.html: A Front-End Developer can have a big tool-box of skills.

content.html: Here are some:

content.html: Want to get your first job? Read our article on how to get a developer job in Ten steps.
